description: Docker is an open platform for developing, shipping, and running applications. Docker enables you to separate your applications from your infrastructure so you can deliver software quickly. With Docker, you can manage your infrastructure in the same ways you manage your applications. By taking advantage of Docker’s methodologies for shipping, testing, and deploying code quickly, you can significantly reduce the delay between writing code and running it in production. In this session we would learn about Docker and applications.

Code is prone to errors. You are absolutely  going to make errors, at least if you’re a human and not a robot. Users don’t see errors by default in the browser. So, if something goes wrong in the script, we won’t see what’s broken and can’t fix it. To figure out what the errors are and get a lot of other useful information about scripts, “Developer tools” have been embedded in browsers. The Developer Console is an integrated development environment with a collection of tools you can use to create, debug, and test applications. Ingenium presents to you a workshop on Developer Console.

eventName: A voyage into the UI/UX world
description: UI design and UX design are two of the most often confused and conflated terms in web and app design. The user interface(UI) is the graphical layout of an application. It consists of the buttons users click on, the text they read, the images, sliders, text entry fields and all the rest of the items the user interacts with. User experience(UX) of the application is determined by how users interact with it. UI designers are tasked with deciding how the UI will look, IX designers are in charge of determining how the UI operates. The session will include the basics of UI/UX and how are these related.

If you wish to learn from the best and create something uber cool this season, Ingenium brings you the perfect opportunity! The Kickstart IoT workshop will introduce you to the world of Arduino microcontroller and will provide an opportunity to create an IoT device or system. The participants would be taught about Arduino and be given a hands-on implementation with various modules that work with it. Furthermore, the workshop will cover the connection with IBM Cloud by industry experts. No chance like now to learn this!

Treasure Hunt is not just about the hunt, it requires much more than that! Ingenium brings you one of its most exciting events, E-Treasure Hunt, a competition where the hunters apply all the techniques known to them and advised by Mr. Google to reach the goal. To hunt for the hidden treasure you need to test your smartness and solve the clues to search for the prize. No running required, but don’t think that’ll let you relax!
rules:
Platform and links used
  • Zoom
  • Google meet
  • Bit.ly links 


Rules
  • There will be 8 - 10 clues/questions in the quiz.
  • People can participate in teams of 2 or 3
  • Each clue might be tech-related.
  • No kind of communication between teams will be allowed.
  • No volunteers will help you in interpreting the clues.


Use case
  1. This game is all about general awareness in tech and common sense.
  2. In this game, there will be 8 - 10 rooms ( Google-Meet meetings links ) according to the number of questions. 
  3. You will be given 1 question in each room which would be shared by our volunteer. Every team will start from room-1 together.
  4. You have to answer the most suitable answer co-relating with the question displayed in the meet room and once you get your answer you will redirect yourself to the next room. For example, if your answer in the first room is python then you will open the link bit.ly/Ingenium-2021_python (bit.ly/Ingenium-2021 will be common in every room) means your answer and you will see a page where you will get another meetlink.
  5. You have to join that link and repeat step 3.
  6. You may continue in this manner and reach the end meet link to finish your hunt.
  7. Even if a single person on the team reaches the final meet link that time may be considered as the final finish time.
  8. After the team reaches the end meeting they will be asked to verify their answers to all the questions, so as to check that everyone has completed each and every question. In case no team manages to clear all rooms, the team clearing maximum rooms will be declared as winners.
  9. Points to be taken care while opening the link:

Links are case-sensitive. You have to use small case letters only. Underscore( _ ) before your answer is must and no space between the words. If your answer is albert einstein then you have to open bit.ly/Ingenium-2021_alberteinstein. If you guess the answer correctly and fail to type it properly in the link then it's completely your fault.
certificatePolicy:
1. Certificate of excellence will be awarded to the top 2
  2. Certificate of participation will be given to all the teams qualified for the final except the top 2
  3. Disqualified teams will not be considered for any

NOTE:- Rules announced by the coordinators during the competition will be considered equally important as those announced earlier.

description: An event where a team of participants will be given virtual currency and would indulge in an auction to buy sensors and equipment required to build a model or a prototype of a system. In the first part of the event, teams will bid for components, as well as for the problem statement that they want. There will be open as well as close bids. The rules of the auction will be conveyed at the time of the event. In the second part, the teams will have to build the prototype of a model/system using the components they have bought using the online platform Tinkercad. Judging will be done on the basis of clarity of idea and the usage of components.
rules:
1. No outside component is allowed. The participants strictly have to bid for each and every component they want to include in their project.
  2. In the auction round, the decisions taken by the auctioneer will be the final No one can argue or overrule that.
  3. No two teams are allowed to e change anything between
  4. All the participants of the particular team have to be present during the whole Absence of any participant in any of the two rounds will not be acceptable.
  5. No team can buy any component in the second round though it has remained unsold after the two rounds of the auction.
  6. Participants have to make their prototype on Tinkercad No other software is allowed to be used.
  7. Team members may communicate with each other while making the prototype using any platform they find However, the main auction, and presentation of the prototype will be done virtually using Zoom meetings.
  8. For any queries or guidance for the prototype stage, team members can contact the volunteers via messaging them in the Discord room that will be allotted to each

Team Specifications:

  1. Each team should consist of minimum 3, maximum 4 members.
certificatePolicy:
1. Certificate of excellence along with appropriate prizes will be awarded to the top 3
  2. Certificate of participation will be given to all the teams qualified for the final except the top 3
  3. Disqualified teams will not be considered for any certificates

description: In this event, a team of 3 members would be given a set of problems that they are supposed to solve under the given time constraint. The platform used for this competition is Hackerrank. Team members are allowed to discuss the problems amongst them and use resources available on the Internet.
rules:
• The medium of the contest is HackerRank. Make a new account on HackerRank named Ingenium21_teamname and submit the details of the same through the form. 
  • The teams are allowed to refer to code online but proper citation must be provided. Although, it is forbidden to communicate about the problems with anyone apart from the team members during the contest.
  • Number of problems and the score distribution would be revealed in the contest itself.
  • For more detailed rules, please keep checking the contest registration page.

 

Duration:

  • 3 hours will be provided for coding.

 

Team specifications:

  • Each team must consist of exactly 3  members only.

 

Eligibility:

  • All the team members should be aged less than 25 years on the date of the contest. 

 

Scoring: 

  • Each challenge has a predetermined score.
  • A team’s score depends on the number of test cases a team’s code submission successfully passes.
  • If a team submits more than one solution per challenge, then the team’s score will reflect the highest score achieved.
  • Teams are ranked by score. If two or more teams achieve the same score, then the tie is broken by the total time taken to submit the last solution resulting in a higher score.
certificatePolicy:
• A certificate of excellence along with appropriate prizes will be awarded to the top 3 teams.
  • Certificate of participation will be given to all the teams who make at least one accepted submission except for the top 3 teams.
  • Disqualified teams will not be considered for any certificates or prizes whatsoever.
  • Ranklist will not be considered final unless the organizers are convinced and have performed the necessary plagiarism checks.

Note: Any competitor found cheating will be disqualified and banned from the contest immediately. The decision taken by the moderator would be considered final and binding. Rules announced by the moderators during the competition will be considered equally important as those announced earlier.

description: If you are a Data Science and Machine Learning enthusiast, get ready for an amazing competition we have for you. Kaggle allows users to find and publish data sets, explore and build models in a web-based data-science environment, work with other data scientists and machine learning engineers, and enter competitions to solve data science challenges. We will be conducting the competition on Kaggle platform. So don’t miss the opportunity as we have some exciting prizes for the winners!
rules:
1. Every participant must have a ​Kaggle​ account.
2. Maximum allowed team size is ​3
3. The competition will last for 4 days.
4. Each team will be able to make 8 submissions per day.
5. There will be a public leaderboard that will be available during the competition and a private leaderboard that will be the final standings. During the competition, each team will be put onto the public leaderboard and the private leaderboard will be made available only at the end of the competition.
4. ​Each team will have to select one solution that they consider final which will be evaluated for the final standings.
5. ​Use of any publicly available library / package is allowed. Use of pretrained models is not permitted. Use of external datasets is not allowed.
certificatePolicy:
1. Every participant must have a ​Kaggle​ account.
2. Maximum allowed team size is ​3
3. The competition will last for 2 weeks

description: The safety of workers and employees is of the utmost importance. Problems usually arise suddenly and hinder the production of the end product. Companies are regularly confronted with these problems and must address them cost-effectively while complying with the appropriate security standards. Test your problem solving and tactical skills to overcome these obstacles. Participants should prepare a presentation on the subject. The text of the issue will be announced 24 hours before the event.
rules:
Judging Criteria:

  1. Sustainability of the solution. 
  2. How well planned and organized the solution is. 
  3. Thoroughly explained visual materials (charts/graphs etc.). 
  4. Limitations of the proposed solution. 
  5. Business plan on paper – should include preliminary market sizing a basic prototyping cost estimates. 
  6. Presentation skills 

Team criteria and norms:

  1. Effectiveness in addressing the questions from the audience.
  2. There can be a maximum of 4 and minimum of 2 members in a team
  3. Teams can have students from same/different year.
  4. The time for preparation of the solution is same for all the teams.
  5. In case a member of the registered team is absent for any reason, the team will have to inform the organizing committee at least 2 hours before the competition or else it will cause the whole team to disqualify.
  6. For any queries, the participants will have to contact the organizing committee at least 4 hours before the commencement of the event.
  7. The decision of the jury will be final and binding to all.
  8. No arguments or challenges will be entertained. 
  9. The organizers have every right to remove, disqualify or in any way prevent a presentation from the demonstration. 
  10. The organizers can cancel or postpone the event as they see fit, and the information will be communicated to the participants. 
  11. Any team not adhering to the rules that are specified here, or communicated to the teams will be given a stern warning, and after misbehaviour will be disqualified.
certificatePolicy:
1. All the team participating will receive certificate of participation.
  2. Disqualified team will not receive any kind of certificate nor will they get refund.

One answer contains the key to another question or one question unlocks some other answer? If you and your team have the right chemistry with your knowledge and ability to use it at the right time, you will surely be able to crack this one!

description: Ever wondered whats and hows of the technology and the designing behind the booming Electric Vehicles?! Well, if you wish to learn from the expert about it, Ingenium x ASME- Ahmedabad University Student Chapter brings you the perfect opportunity a talk on - EV Charging Infrastructure

speakers.designation: Lead Associate EV Charging, Tata Power Company Limited

description: The rotating machinery finds extensive application in a variety of industries such as aerospace industry, electric power industry, textile industry, automotive industry, mining industry and energy industry, etc.It’s just a matter of the past few decades, that the industries have realized the importance of maintenance of these rotating machines that are actually installed in huge numbers in industrial settings. A failure of a single rotating machinery leads to huge economic losses because of higher production downtimes and increased maintenance activities. In addition, the chances of human casualties are tremendously increased. The present seminar focuses on discussing efficacious condition-monitoring tools and solutions with an aim to eradicate the catastrophic failures in roto-mechanical equipment before it occurs and thus prevent the related damaging consequences.

Tinker with robots in one of the most exciting workshops of Ingenium 2021! The Talk on Robotics will cover the basics and also the nitty-gritty of creating a task-oriented robot from scratch. The participants would be informed about the vast field of robotics along with brief knowledge about building their robot.

eventName: Project management- a smart career choice
description: Event will cover the points regarding the jobs Chemical engineer will have to do in industry, the challenge he/she has to go through and also as sanjay sir is one of the most senior person of industry we will hear his experience and from falak sor we will learn about project management.

eventName: Research and development in Agrochemical sector.
description: It's an virtual industrial visit, in one of the biggest R&D centers of Gujarat named Meghmani organics limited. Dr Bhavesh Vyas will address the talk and will make you go through it's Agrochemical sector. Main agenda to be talked on are discovery, development, evolution & trails, scale up, regulatory and manufacturing.

Associate director Dr. Srinivas of ISRO along with Prof. Iyyer would be addressing the participants and enlightening them about Finite Element Analysis (FEA) and its applications. FEA uses mathematical models to understand and quantify the effects of real-world conditions on a part or assembly. These simulations, which are conducted via specialised software, allow engineers to locate potential problems in a design, including areas of tension and weak spots.

speakers.designation: ,Associate Director, Space infrastructure, ISRO HQ, Bangalore.

description: Tech Ingenium 2021 collaborating with ASME-Ahmedabad University Student Section brings you another exciting talk to add to the list. The Talk on Space Engineering- Today and Tomorrow. The talk will introduce you to one of the flourishing field of science-Space Engineering. The event will revolve around the aspects discussing the technologies being used, future opportunities and how the field has grown over the time
